intro: Desmodium lempirae, commonly known as the Lempira burr legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive pod fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Desmodium lempirae is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings. Its growth habit and ecological role make it an important species in local flora.
